lines.text: Okay. Cool. For Dispel Magic, I need you to go ahead, just for the sake of this-- I won't consider it contested because you're allies in this thing. So you land. Tiberius' form shimmers and returns back to that of a dragonborn, and you're standing there on the precipice. Go ahead and roll a perception check.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What is that? 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. It's hard to make out the details, but the voice is definitely coming from the nest. You see there is something vaguely humanoid, but it's hard to make out the shape at this distance with this low light, especially since you aren't a darkvision-gifted entity. However, it's close to this bird creature.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to say, is this big bird thing asleep?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You will not harm this creature, poachers!"

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm not trying to harm it at all. I'm just seeing if it's fine. If we could talk. I can't see anything, and I wanted to cast Light so I could see something, but I don't want to hurt your bird's eyes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see the bird's moving and it's looking towards your direction. And it has this like (soft snarl).

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: So it's awake?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's awake, and it looks hurt. The voice is like, "You come here masqueraded as whatever "manner of beasts that you are--"

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Cows. We were cows.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "After tormenting and severely wounding this beautiful creature."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: We didn't do anything to the creature. No, we were-- This creature was stealing the farmer's cows, and the farmers were saying, "You've taken our livestock," which is hurting the farm. We came to help them and we posed as cows, and then your bird took our--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While he's blithering, can I make an additional cow stealth check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To come up behind the guy. Near him. Not even near him. Just to get a better vantage point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. Make it with a disadvantage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does that cancel out with my advantage from my cloak?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A cow in a cloak.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are a flying cow in the moonlight against an individual that is very aware of your presence.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's 31.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. 31.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pretty small. Scanlan small. Hard to make out details, but it is currently in the process of doing a repeated hand motion and then touching. A hand motion and then touching. And you've seen this motion before.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Touching what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Touching the bird. There is a perpetual string of Cure Wounds being applied to this bird.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I also approach and come out of my eagle form.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Light.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you landing somewhere?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Next to Tiberius.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: But I'm going to block it with my hand so it's not going to blind the bird.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Holding up his arm-- and looks thin. It's covering the light and he's like, "You!"

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Sorry. I tried to not blind you. It was very dark. I'm sorry. Hello. We mean you no harm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The gnome slams this small wooden, for lack of a better term, a small staff or cane. Slams it into the ground with a foot stomp and you can see the gnome's entire body suddenly begin to shift and change into this dark, gnarled-looking, hard surface.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I whack him in the back of the head.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No! It's just Barkskin! It's just defense!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He doesn't know. All right. So you cow stealth up to the side of this guy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's get ready to rumble.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Go ahead and make an attack.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I pause.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You pause? You are currently now crouched right behind the edge of this nest, and you can't even actually see the guy anymore because in order to get up there, you've come underneath to stay hidden and you're just there behind.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I see Vax?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. Well, actually go ahead and roll a perception check. Is it higher than a 31?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it higher than a 31? No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have no idea where Vax is.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm way up above them still, right? Do I see anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, actually. You see, there's another section above there. It looks like there's nothing else of interest, other than some growth, a few bushes, and some vines that hang down the side.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Somebody talk to him before I kill this fucking bird.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I am talking to him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I land beside Tiberius and come out of eagle form. Tiberius, would you please Dispel this cow form from me. Please? Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. And with that, you cast Dispel Magic and Keyleth's form reverts that to Keyleth. Normal Keyleth. Non-cow Keyleth. The gnome character now has the staff at the back and has a hand in front and is like, (panting).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you a druid? I'm also a druid. I think our goals might be aligned.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Really?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's okay. What's her name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This creature has no name to it yet. I, myself, am a protector of the wild, as you claim "to be, as well. I have no tribe but the trees around me. I hear the whisper of the wind, and it "calls for justice."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can relate to that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then why do you follow? Why do you insist on harming this creature?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because we were seeking justice for other people.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Why? For the civilized folk of the city? You should know more than most. They sit there, "taking beautiful creatures of nature, making them fat and formless and worth nothing. To "slaughter them without life and purpose to their existence."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: The life and purpose of their existence is to keep those other people alive.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And why is it not the same with this creature? If they cannot guard their livestock, "why is it not food for this thing, as well? It is the natural life cycle that they've removed "themselves from."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: When one has an establishment, when one grows its own crop, and one steals something, it is considered a crime.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, when one is not part of that civilization, but the civilization of the world as "a whole, which requires hunting for what keeps you alive, perhaps that does not sink or hang on my "conscience."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Fair point.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's not let this escalate. Okay? What is your name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I was once called Byron."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Vyron?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Byron."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Byron.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have not heard my name nor spoken words for many years."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: And this is my friend Keyleth, who is also a druid. And we also have a friend who is a gnome who sings songs and whatnot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This giant beak that looks like it could snap you in two with a single bite.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I reach up to it and reach out to pet its beak.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm going to ask you to make an animal handling check on this. Just to see where this goes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I gently start swooping down to check on my friends.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Doesn't bite your hand off.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I kneel down a bit. Produce a few Goodberries. Reach out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bye, Keyleth. This is how we lose one of our members. Feeding a bird.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The creature leans forward and the giant bird, you can see its dark, black eyes staring at you. Each eye probably about the size of your torso. As the giant beak comes down, you can see the moonlight gliding off the smooth exterior of the dark black beak. It smells. And you take 27 points of piercing damage as the animal takes the Goodberries and almost your entire hand with it, as well. At that size, it's hard to be gentle.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's okay. It's all right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you retract your hand, which is now essentially in many ways, bones are broken, feels like. There's blood streaming down the side of your hand, and (dripping).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a good girl.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Swallows.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it a good girl?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm feeding a tiny snack to Lockheed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I turn back to Byron--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And say, ow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, and go, that hurt. Now. Please listen to me. Please, please listen to me. We did come here to kill the giant creature.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I had assumed."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But upon seeing the situation, upon approach, realized the situation and decided amongst all of us that we did not want to bring such a great creature to its death.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan, you've landed by now. A pterodactyl. A cow-looking pterodactyl.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: As he swoops, I've never seen anything quite like it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to aid her, too.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All I've seen so far is Keyleth's bloody hand.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 20 total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have advantage on this because Tiberius is aiding you on this conversation.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll take that 20 total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. He looks at you. "Well, shall you leave us, then?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Under one condition.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There's always a condition. You call yourself a druid, yet you speak like the civilized "folk. I get the feeling that perhaps your connection to nature has not been tended to for "some time."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No, she really knows her stuff. I mean, we just fought this fire guy--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just because one can appreciate nature, does not mean that one cannot also appreciate humanity.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, this beautiful creature is the only surviving young of a clutch, bred by a majestic "roc high in the Cliffkeep Mountains. Its mother now lies dead, slain by the brutal giants that "wander those peaks. This young'un is all that remains of that clutch and the memory of that "blessed entity."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a young'un?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is a young one. "This new home serves us well. Abundance of feed. Lack of large, "predatory creatures. I believe this is where we'll stay."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Question. If this is a young, adolescent creature, what do you think of the destruction it could cause once it reaches full adulthood? Are you okay with having that on your conscience? This creature could result in the lives of many. If you relocate out of town, just a few miles. Say like 50 or 100 or so because this thing's really damn big. So I'm sure it's got a pretty big-- you know what I mean.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Or just the other way.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I will help you. I will personally come with you and tend to their safety. And make sure that their location is proper and safe, and handled with respect. Then you will be out of the harms of poachers. You can live off the land, and you can be free and alone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This, as far as I can see, is the safest. It's the most ignored by nearby civilization."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Listen--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to drop Seeming and also drop my form of pterodactyl.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All of you now, your forms change. As this happens mid-sentence, it's noticed immediately by the gnome druid, who's like (gasps).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I suggest you heed our warning, take our help, and save the life of you and your creature in the long run.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You have yet to provide a suitable alternative."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh! I might have an idea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There is an alternative. Tiberius can tell you of that alternative.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes! See, your creature is rather large and powerful, yes? You have a rather strong bond with him, which is quite unique with such a unique looking creature.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was setting you up for an awesome one-liner, man! You were supposed to be like, the other option is death.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ask him if he's considered Whitestone?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Whitestone? Yeah! Well, I guess there's a couple of options, really. There's this town Whitestone that's pretty great and has a lot of livestock that this creature can consume.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I don't know about that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a deception check.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That is a 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Whitestone. How far is this Whitestone?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait! No! Hang on! No! This is getting out of control already. I will not let you all do this! No! Not today. You guys have caused enough problems. We are not going to push this creature on other people. I'm trying, all right? I'm working on it. I don't want to push this problem off on a town that's already being held hostage by vampires. That fucking sucks! That's double shitting on them.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Well, the other option was, like I was saying, perhaps you can form an agreement with Emon. I'm sure it would pay in livestock rather well for the protection of you, such a powerful druid, over at least a section of the land. In exchange for free food for your friend.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You, dragon man, are adorably naive of the ways of men and those that lie and deceive. I have "yet to have met any civilized people who have kept their word when it came to creatures like this."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's plentiful forests, tons of giant creatures it could feed on.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That's right! That's true!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That actually is fairly true.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's so many monsters out there, they don't hunt them all because there's too many.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That's a wonderful idea, Vex. Yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'll aid her, as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This'll just be her check on this. He really doesn't trust you, given the current circumstances.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then as a natural 20, you know that's good for you. That's the best place you can go. You can see the wisdom in my persuasion.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It is true, though. I mean, it's just feed walking all around for it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Please, please listen to us. We're only trying to help.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there a young creature around here besides the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, looking about you, no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's no babies there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. This is the young. This bird is like the adolescent.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Please believe me. I let this thing almost take my hand off, and I'm still standing here fairly cogently talking to you, so please take that as a sign of honesty.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I go and put my hand on her back and cast Cure Wounds, because I got that spell now, yo!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where are we telling them to go?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: To Vasselheim.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Vasselheim?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're a part of their guild. We can tell them that you're coming. They'll not bother you. We can tell them they are not allowed to take out a contract on your creature. You will not be harmed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't bring up contracts, Keyleth. Maybe just don't even bring it up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because they don't have mercenaries out there. It has to be approved! So it's really good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And what's to stop them from hunting down a majestic creature as rare as this one?"

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Us!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You, who live here in Emon?"

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes. No, us who are members of the guild.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So you also are monster slayers, who come here under the guise to slay this monster?"

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No! Not here. Other places that we're forced to do it. But still we're members.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's too much talk."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we kill this thing now? You guys are doing awesome.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like I've done pretty damn good! Come on, man!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're giving you a good choice, a safe choice. We can help you get there and be safe there. But if you don't listen to us, we'll start killing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion roll.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How many fucking persuasion rolls does this asshole need?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Persuasion?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is essentially a conversational skill challenge. So every success and failure leads towards where the conversation's going to end.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He gives you a look. Very intense, looking into your very essence-type stare. His little beady gnomish eyes meeting yours. (sighs) "If we're going to make this journey to where you say "this Vasselheim is, how far is it?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Several days' journey.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's just across the water. You could fly no problem over it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Across the sea?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's across the sea.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can draw you a map. We can give you provisions. We'll even make sure the farmers provide you with a few pieces of livestock to chow down on before the journey. A parting gift to fuel up before the big ride. We can give you papers to hand to the Slayer's Take that will ensure that you'll be treated fairly.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'll take out my Scroll of Telescription and start writing a note.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks back towards Keyleth, looks back at Scanlan, looks back at Keyleth, looks up at the bird.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Please. We really don't need another death on our conscience today.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then looks like we don't have much of a choice, do we? If you can assure us enough food to "get across on this journey, we'll make our way towards this Vasselheim. I pray on the solidarity "between our kin, and our kin, that you speak the truth that resonates this moment. Because if it "does not, may the fall of this entity and myself weigh on your conscience."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I flip over the note that I'm writing to him and then I trigger it (flying noise) as he's reading it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. It (poof) vanishes. "As the sun rises, two sizable pieces of livestock to be "placed at the boundaries of the usual hunting site. If those are there, and it is taken without "any sort of aggression, we'll take that as a sign that you are being honest, and we shan't bother "you or your people any further."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I bow deeply and when I do, it goes (cowbell ringing).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For a moment, you think you hear a slight, uncontrollable chuckle from the gnome.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: As that's going on, because we're going to head back right now to seal this up, right? Then I'll do my Teleportation Circle. Which is closer to the northeast: the Lyceum or the Keep?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To the north side of it? That would be the Lyceum.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could fly back pretty fast. Couldn't we?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If he has another Fly spell, you could take it right back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we can just fly back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Before he leaves. Well, wait! We've got to go to the farm.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've got to go to the farmers. We've got to buy some cows off them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I tell him, if you're up that way, there's a druidic tribe, a little village called Pyrah. They're Fire Ashari. You can find their headmaster Cerkonos. He's a friend. You might find your people there. Who knows? Maybe friends will do you good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ashari, you say? My dealings with them have been mixed. Perhaps I'll keep my distance."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I see if there's any feathers dropped from the giant bird creature?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are ample around.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I grab a few of them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you go and reach up, slaps you across the knuckles.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I have a feather that he dropped?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Why?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because they're beautiful. You have to admit they're beautiful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (sighs) "Elves. All right."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take three roc feathers.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They're huge, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. They're almost boat size.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I put one in my Bag of Holding, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys manage to get one for you and three for you guys before he's like, "Now go! Now! My "patience wears thin. I'm through with talking words." (sighs)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I walk out from behind him and just walk past.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (yelps)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughs) Sorry about that.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: All right. I'll burn another 5th-level and then fly us all out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys coast back to the north side of Emon. You go to the door where the Klaus family is, and you speak with them for a while. You manage to convince them of the situation and what seems to be a mutually positive circumstance. They agree it's better to lose two cows than continue this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I pay them for their two cows. Being nice, man!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How much do you give them?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much are cows usually worth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've never purchased a cow, so you don't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes I have! I purchased Dork the ox.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: An ox is not a cow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit! How much do your cows normally cost, darling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would put it at about maybe 40 gold each.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's way more than I expected.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because they can be used for meat, they can be used for milk.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 40 gold each to make up for the loss of your cows.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you so much. I greatly appreciate you helping with this. And you promise, this will--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, just put them out in the open field.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll take them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, we'll take them?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll put them out there. Stake them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, we'll take care of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys take two of the cows. You bring them to the outskirts. With rope tied around their neck, you essentially hitching-post them to the outside of this open area, about 20 to 30 feet from the actual holding pen. A few hours go by, and the sun slowly begins to rise.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Along with some other food, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The wings beating in the air, and it swoops down (swoosh) and grabs two of them. You can see some of the families gasp and rush inside, and some are amazed to see this even happen. It takes the two, carries them up, and heads out over the Ozmit Sea, passing to the northwest side, and over the next 30 or so minutes, slowly disappears over the horizon until it's no longer visible.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The sun rose, right? Can I make a beard check? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You may.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Two, zero.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, (creak) the beginnings of the other side of your beard slowly begins to set in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What happens to the existing side?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The existing side has rounded itself off to a nice beard. It's pretty much where it's going to be on that side. The other side is now starting to finally catch up. And that's where we'll end: on a successful beard check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow. That was a crazy night.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Perspiration was happening.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it was.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I gave you my hand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: More battle maps that will never get used.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Look at us not fighting things. That's really beautiful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would have been really bad, too.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm glad we didn't fight it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Bad for us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Would have been an interesting fight. Cool. That concludes a unique Percy-less bottle episode of Critical Role.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Squadron of cows.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Squadron of flying midnight cows. That is probably the weirdest thing that's ever-- no, there's been weirder. That's in the top five of weird things that's happened in DND for me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fighting "formootion." (groaning) [end of transcript]
